intro: Pyramidanthe cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical pyramidanthe, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, cylindrical flower clusters. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and they bloom in racemes. Pyramidanthe cylindrica is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
